content.content: Deco Forum Q1 Progress Report The Deco Team has had a very successful First Quarter and we wish to bring you up to date on our progress.  Organization and Operations. The Deco Team is functioning as an outside organization providing development and support services to Maker.  We are live and operational; inquiries regarding Deco on Maker can be directed to [email protected]. Vamsi can be reached at: [email protected]. An operational staff is in place and a legal team including a corporate General Counsel to address legal issues.  Q1 Deco Development Status. The Deco on Maker core codebase, because of intense effort, is complete. It has also been subject to refactoring to simplify the Maker integration.  Documentation is also completed and available here. At this point, we have completed both the DSS-Gate sandbox development as well as completing the core Deco on Maker integration. DSS-gate was first presented during the G&R call in January and has now been delivered to PE. PE will take stewardship over the DSS-Gate contracts moving forward. The initial audit of the core integration has been completed by ChainSecurity and validates the integration design, implementation, and functionality. The final audit report will be uploaded to the documentation repository when available.  Q2 Deco Tentative Agenda. We expect completion of the Final Audit report for the Core Codebase and the Gate no later than the end of May. In Q2, we will also complete the UI and UX design process for the initial product. Our legal team will be engaging with Patent, Copyright, Securities, and other pertinent legal issues. We will also engage in pre-launch preparation, including formulating a general strategy or alignment with other Maker core units regarding potential users as well as requesting a “go live” for Q3/Q4, including an introductory Deco/DSS-Gate approval limit.  Q2 Progress Report. Our next report will synchronize Deco with the calendar year and be on 15 July 2022.

I thought we voted down fixed rate integrations last week? Or is this the term lending module the guys at Yield Protocol were saying was supposed to happen? Also, one of the delegates (@flipflopflapdelegate) pointed out on another thread that there seemed to be no market for fixed rates? What’s the policy here? Maker is doing fixed rates or it is not?
Ippy:  Also, one of the delegates (@flipflopflapdelegate) pointed out on another thread that there seemed to be no market for fixed rates?    This is a good question. @flipflopflapdelegate

It’s unfortunate that this report didn’t get as many feedbacks. My question is regarding this on Deco website: "You can see it in action in the integrations we have discovered so far and we hope you consider building one to seamlessly bring fixed-rates as a feature to your protocol and governance. Send us a note at [email protected] with your questions regarding integrations with Deco and we will help you out." Considering the Maker protocol is funding not only salaries but even travel, legal, and marketing cost, shouldn’t Deco be exclusive to Maker protocol? Wouldn’t it be more than unfair that Maker protocol funds for such development which Deco team can potentially make more money for building it for other protocols?
Bumping this because literally no one is responding to questions, and they seem like fair ones to me. I hope after Easter we can get these questions addressed

Ippy:  What’s the policy here? Maker is doing fixed rates or it is not?       Doo_StableLab:  Considering the Maker protocol is funding not only salaries but even travel, legal, and marketing cost, shouldn’t Deco be exclusive to Maker protocol? Wouldn’t it be more than unfair that Maker protocol funds for such development which Deco team can potentially make more money for building it for other protocols?   Bumping all of these fair questions again - surprised at the lack of communication here. It’s interesting that while some cost centres for Maker attract a lot of heat and attention like Events, others seem to slip under the radar completely. It may be that Deco has good answers to all of the questions above but we wouldn’t know (in governance) because none have been provided. Particularly now we are in a bear market, there seems to be a dangerous tendency of focusing on the CU spend that is the most clearly communicated, because it is the easiest to see (and critique). That produces a twisted incentive for CUs to present a low profile, communicate as little as possible, and quietly collect cheques from Maker (another 500 MKR is vesting for this CU in the current executive). That’s not something we should want as a DAO.

Tagging @vamsi, @Deco-Core-Unit to get their thoughts. Again, it may be there are good answers to the questions posed above and Deco is providing excellent value, but it’s hard to draw that conclusion in a vacuum so I do think it’s fair to ask these kinds of questions. Reading the Q1 progress report closely, Deco seems to mostly be providing technical work and support to PE. I would love to know more about the delineation between Deco’s work for Maker and Deco’s work elsewhere - for instance, is the legal advice around “patent, copyright, securities etc” strictly for Deco or is it also shared with PE and other CUs?
Deco will be providing its quarterly report on July 15 and will address the questions and concerns posed here in that update.

vamsi:  Deco will be providing its quarterly report on July 15 and will address the questions and concerns posed here in that update   I am looking forward to that quarterly report, but it seems strange that Deco cannot offer even brief responses to some of the questions raised in this thread since April. That doesn’t seem in the spirit of a CU working at the behest of a decentralised organisation. If the community has questions about your Q2 report in July, will we have to wait until the Q3 report for a response…?

Respect for anyone developing for maker but these are fair questions raised. Would be great to hear from the team if there is a deployed product and if the team still thinks there is a market for fixed rate lending in scale.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
